What our pets see in their dreams... I don't know, but I would imagine the experience is similar to humans.

The problem is, we have no idea if dreaming is necessary for all people. Yes, there's evidence that all people need REM and Stage 4 sleep, and most people report dreaming during these stages. But some people don't, and just saying "they forgot they were dreaming," is an unfalsifiable hypothesis. It's also possible that the exact same brain wave patterns can result in two different qualitative experiences.

The idea that dreams only happen during REM  is not a valid one. It can easily be disproven by falling asleep directly into a dream, before your brain could possibly start REM. So just because an animal doesn't reach REM the same, or even have a REM state, does not mean they can't dream.
